definition: to make someone weak or infirm
sentence: The disease can debilitate even the strongest of individuals.

definition: optimistic or positive, especially in an apparently bad or difficult situation
sentence: Despite the challenges, she remained sanguine about the future.

definition: reserved or uncommunicative in speech; saying little
sentence: His taciturn nature made it difficult for others to get to know him.

definition: a highly unpleasant or unhealthy smell or vapor
sentence: The miasma of the swamp made it difficult to breathe.

definition: to make a disease or its symptoms less severe without removing the cause
sentence: The medication is used to palliate the pain from chronic conditions.
The salubrious climate of the mountains was a welcome change.
His temerarious actions often put him in dangerous situations.
The yare movements of the dancer captivated the audience.
The zephyr blew softly through the trees, bringing a sense of peace.

definition: cease to resist an opponent; surrender.
sentence: After weeks of negotiations, the company had no choice but to capitulate to the union's demands.
